metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7238 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Netty 4.1.43.Final allows HTTP Request Smuggling because it mishandles Transfer-Encoding whitespace (such as a [space]Transfer-Encoding:chunked line) and a later Content-Length header. This issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2019-16869. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netty package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.6.Final-2+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm1').
